content:
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION
Regional Office for the Western Pacific United Nations Avenue
Ermita-MANILA, PHILIPPINES P. O. BOX 2932
In reply please refer to : China F/8 and F/19
Prière de rappeler la référence :
TELEPHONE : 5 20 41
ORGANISATION MONDIALE DE LA SANTÉ
Bureau régional du Pacifique occidental United Nations Avenue
Ermita-MANILLE, PHILIPPINES TELEGR. : UNISANTE, MANILA TELEX: MN 3260
23 January 1963
Dear Dr. Chang,
I wish to forward herewith the formal letters of award for Mr. Eugene Chen and Dr. Chien-tao Huang, both of the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory, for whom placement at the School of Hygiene, Toronto, for the 1963 bacteriology course, has been requested. After completing the course, Mr. Chen will undertake specialized work in vaccine production while Dr. Huang, on the other hand, spends the remaining time of his fellowship, in practical work in selected virus laboratories.
I should like to point out that the final acceptance of the two fellows is contingent on their passing the English language proficiency test which will be given by the Michigan English Language Institute early this year. This decision to administer the test is based on the results of the language tests previously given to Mr. Chen (July 1962) and Dr. Huang (August 1962) which indicated that they were barely proficient for a travel grant. As standards for applicants for academic fellowships are even higher than those for travel fellows, it is considered necessary to have the language proficiency of both fellows re-evaluated.
I should appreciate it if you would inform me as soon as possible whether or not Mr. Chen and Dr. Huang will be ready to take the examination by February or March this year.
hur chen Dr. Huang
Yours sincerely,
7-8-0g
for
I. C. Fang, M.D. Regional Director
Dr. C.K. Chang Director Department of Health Administration Ministry of Interior Taipei, Taiwan Republic of China
ENCL .: As stated.
cc: Dr. C.T. Loo, Taiwan Dr. T.C. Hsu, Taiwan WHO Representative, Taipei The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Taiwan
NA+PANT /SH
上午来以一张
元文涛
NE) In FIN DE , ON FE 1/ Egils
Acada Historica
6

Regional Office for the Western Pacific United Nations Avenue
In reply please refer to : China F/8 and F/19
Bureau régional du Pacifique occidental United Nations Avenue
Ermita-MANILLE, PHILIPPINES TELEGR. : UNISANTE, MANILA TELEX: MN 3260

I wish to forward herewith the formal letters of award for Mr. Eugene Chen and Dr. Chien-tao Huang, both of the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory, for whom placement at the School of Hygiene, Toronto, for the 1963 bacteriology course, has been requested. After completing the course, Mr. Chen will undertake specialized work in vaccine production while Dr. Huang, on the other hand, spends the remaining time of his fellowship, in practical work in selected virus laboratories.

I should like to point out that the final acceptance of the two fellows is contingent on their passing the English language proficiency test which will be given by the Michigan English Language Institute early this year. This decision to administer the test is based on the results of the language tests previously given to Mr. Chen (July 1962) and Dr. Huang (August 1962) which indicated that they were barely proficient for a travel grant. As standards for applicants for academic fellowships are even higher than those for travel fellows, it is considered necessary to have the language proficiency of both fellows re-evaluated.
I should appreciate it if you would inform me as soon as possible whether or not Mr. Chen and Dr. Huang will be ready to take the examination by February or March this year.
I. C. Fang, M.D. Regional Director
Dr. C.K. Chang Director Department of Health Administration Ministry of Interior Taipei, Taiwan Republic of China
cc: Dr. C.T. Loo, Taiwan Dr. T.C. Hsu, Taiwan WHO Representative, Taipei The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Taiwan
NE) In FIN DE , ON FE 1/ Egils
